page.title: 07THE RIVERS OF BEWCASTLE
page.content: The survey region is drained by two branches of the River Lyne which here have the names Black and White Lyne.The former is so called because it has drained a peaty area of fells and is often dark in colour.The White Lyne, although not rising very far away , drains a more sandy basin. Both rivers provide a habitat for the usual wild-life, in the water are trout, sea-trout, eels and ,in season, salmon ,as well as the many smaller water creatures, on the banks otters and mink have been seen.
